name: tls
description: A Pulumi package to create TLS resources in Pulumi programs.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`tls` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/hashicorp/terraform-provider-tls).

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package to create TLS resources in Pulumi programs.
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/hashicorp/terraform-provider-tls)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-tls` repo](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-tls/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-tls` repo](https://github.com/hashicorp/terraform-provider-tls/issues).

python.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/hashicorp/terraform-provider-tls)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-tls` repo](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-tls/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-tls` repo](https://github.com/hashicorp/terraform-provider-tls/issues).

proxy.description: Proxy used by resources and data sources that connect to external endpoints.

fromEnv.description: When `true` the provider will discover the proxy configuration from environment variables. This is based upon [`http.ProxyFromEnvironment`](https://pkg.go.dev/net/http#ProxyFromEnvironment) and it supports the same environment variables (default: `true`).

password.description: Password used for Basic authentication against the Proxy.

url.description: URL used to connect to the Proxy. Accepted schemes are: `http`, `https`, `socks5`.

username.description: Username (or Token) used for Basic authentication against the Proxy.

fromEnv.description: When `true` the provider will discover the proxy configuration from environment variables. This is based upon [`http.ProxyFromEnvironment`](https://pkg.go.dev/net/http#ProxyFromEnvironment) and it supports the same environment variables (default: `true`).

password.description: Password used for Basic authentication against the Proxy.

url.description: URL used to connect to the Proxy. Accepted schemes are: `http`, `https`, `socks5`.

username.description: Username (or Token) used for Basic authentication against the Proxy.

isCa.description: `true` if the certificate is of a CA (Certificate Authority).

issuer.description: Who verified and signed the certificate, roughly following [RFC2253](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2253).

notAfter.description: The time until which the certificate is invalid, as an [RFC3339](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339) timestamp.

notBefore.description: The time after which the certificate is valid, as an [RFC3339](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339) timestamp.

publicKeyAlgorithm.description: The key algorithm used to create the certificate.

serialNumber.description:
Number that uniquely identifies the certificate with the CA's system.
The `format` function can be used to convert this *base 10* number into other bases, such as hex.

sha1Fingerprint.description: The SHA1 fingerprint of the public key of the certificate.

signatureAlgorithm.description: The algorithm used to sign the certificate.

subject.description: The entity the certificate belongs to, roughly following [RFC2253](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2253).

version.description: The version the certificate is in.

provider.description:
The provider type for the tls package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

proxy.description: Proxy used by resources and data sources that connect to external endpoints.
Proxy used by resources and data sources that connect to external endpoints.

certRequestPem.description: The certificate request data in PEM (RFC 1421).

dnsNames.description: List of DNS names for which a certificate is being requested (i.e. certificate subjects).

ipAddresses.description: List of IP addresses for which a certificate is being requested (i.e. certificate subjects).

keyAlgorithm.description: Name of the algorithm used when generating the private key provided in `private_key_pem`.

privateKeyPem.description: Private key in PEM (RFC 1421) interpolation function.

subject.description: The subject for which a certificate is being requested. The acceptable arguments are all optional and their naming is based upon [Issuer Distinguished Names (RFC5280)](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5280#section-4.1.2.4) section.

uris.description: List of URIs for which a certificate is being requested (i.e. certificate subjects).

ipAddresses.description: List of IP addresses for which a certificate is being requested (i.e. certificate subjects).

subject.description: The subject for which a certificate is being requested. The acceptable arguments are all optional and their naming is based upon [Issuer Distinguished Names (RFC5280)](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5280#section-4.1.2.4) section.

uris.description: List of URIs for which a certificate is being requested (i.e. certificate subjects).

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering CertRequest resources.

dnsNames.description: List of DNS names for which a certificate is being requested (i.e. certificate subjects).

ipAddresses.description: List of IP addresses for which a certificate is being requested (i.e. certificate subjects).

keyAlgorithm.description: Name of the algorithm used when generating the private key provided in `private_key_pem`.

privateKeyPem.description: Private key in PEM (RFC 1421) interpolation function.

subject.description: The subject for which a certificate is being requested. The acceptable arguments are all optional and their naming is based upon [Issuer Distinguished Names (RFC5280)](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5280#section-4.1.2.4) section.

uris.description: List of URIs for which a certificate is being requested (i.e. certificate subjects).

allowedUses.description: List of key usages allowed for the issued certificate. Values are defined in [RFC 5280](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc5280) and combine flags defined by both [Key Usages](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc5280#section-4.2.1.3) and [Extended Key Usages](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc5280#section-4.2.1.12). Accepted values: `any_extended`, `cert_signing`, `client_auth`, `code_signing`, `content_commitment`, `crl_signing`, `data_encipherment`, `decipher_only`, `digital_signature`, `email_protection`, `encipher_only`, `ipsec_end_system`, `ipsec_tunnel`, `ipsec_user`, `key_agreement`, `key_encipherment`, `microsoft_commercial_code_signing`, `microsoft_kernel_code_signing`, `microsoft_server_gated_crypto`, `netscape_server_gated_crypto`, `ocsp_signing`, `server_auth`, `timestamping`.

caCertPem.description: Certificate data of the Certificate Authority (CA) in [PEM (RFC 1421)](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc1421) format.

caKeyAlgorithm.description: Name of the algorithm used when generating the private key provided in `ca_private_key_pem`.

caPrivateKeyPem.description: Private key of the Certificate Authority (CA) used to sign the certificate, in [PEM (RFC 1421)](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc1421) format.

earlyRenewalHours.description:
The resource will consider the certificate to have expired the given number of hours before its actual expiry time. This
can be useful to deploy an updated certificate in advance of the expiration of the current certificate. However, the old
certificate remains valid until its true expiration time, since this resource does not (and cannot) support certificate
revocation. Also, this advance update can only be performed should the Terraform configuration be applied during the
early renewal period. (default: `0`)

isCaCertificate.description: Is the generated certificate representing a Certificate Authority (CA) (default: `false`).

readyForRenewal.description: Is the certificate either expired (i.e. beyond the `validity_period_hours`) or ready for an early renewal (i.e. within the `early_renewal_hours`)?

setSubjectKeyId.description: Should the generated certificate include a [subject key identifier](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc5280#section-4.2.1.2) (default: `false`).

validityEndTime.description: The time until which the certificate is invalid, expressed as an [RFC3339](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339) timestamp.

validityPeriodHours.description: Number of hours, after initial issuing, that the certificate will remain valid for.

validityStartTime.description: The time after which the certificate is valid, expressed as an [RFC3339](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339) timestamp.

allowedUses.description: List of key usages allowed for the issued certificate. Values are defined in [RFC 5280](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc5280) and combine flags defined by both [Key Usages](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc5280#section-4.2.1.3) and [Extended Key Usages](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc5280#section-4.2.1.12). Accepted values: `any_extended`, `cert_signing`, `client_auth`, `code_signing`, `content_commitment`, `crl_signing`, `data_encipherment`, `decipher_only`, `digital_signature`, `email_protection`, `encipher_only`, `ipsec_end_system`, `ipsec_tunnel`, `ipsec_user`, `key_agreement`, `key_encipherment`, `microsoft_commercial_code_signing`, `microsoft_kernel_code_signing`, `microsoft_server_gated_crypto`, `netscape_server_gated_crypto`, `ocsp_signing`, `server_auth`, `timestamping`.

isCaCertificate.description: Is the generated certificate representing a Certificate Authority (CA) (default: `false`).

readyForRenewal.description: Is the certificate either expired (i.e. beyond the `validity_period_hours`) or ready for an early renewal (i.e. within the `early_renewal_hours`)?

setSubjectKeyId.description: Should the generated certificate include a [subject key identifier](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc5280#section-4.2.1.2) (default: `false`).

validityEndTime.description: The time until which the certificate is invalid, expressed as an [RFC3339](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339) timestamp.

validityPeriodHours.description: Number of hours, after initial issuing, that the certificate will remain valid for.

validityStartTime.description: The time after which the certificate is valid, expressed as an [RFC3339](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339) timestamp.

algorithm.description: Name of the algorithm to use when generating the private key. Currently-supported values are: `RSA`, `ECDSA`, `ED25519`.

ecdsaCurve.description: When `algorithm` is `ECDSA`, the name of the elliptic curve to use. Currently-supported values are: `P224`, `P256`, `P384`, `P521`. (default: `P224`).

privateKeyOpenssh.description: Private key data in [OpenSSH PEM (RFC 4716)](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc4716) format.

privateKeyPemPkcs8.description: Private key data in [PKCS#8 PEM (RFC 5208)](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc5208) format.

publicKeyFingerprintMd5.description: The fingerprint of the public key data in OpenSSH MD5 hash format, e.g. `aa:bb:cc:...`. Only available if the selected private key format is compatible, similarly to `public_key_openssh` and the ECDSA P224 limitations.

publicKeyFingerprintSha256.description: The fingerprint of the public key data in OpenSSH SHA256 hash format, e.g. `SHA256:...`. Only available if the selected private key format is compatible, similarly to `public_key_openssh` and the ECDSA P224 limitations.

publicKeyOpenssh.description: The public key data in "Authorized Keys".

rsaBits.description: When `algorithm` is `RSA`, the size of the generated RSA key, in bits (default: `2048`).

algorithm.description: Name of the algorithm to use when generating the private key. Currently-supported values are: `RSA`, `ECDSA`, `ED25519`.

ecdsaCurve.description: When `algorithm` is `ECDSA`, the name of the elliptic curve to use. Currently-supported values are: `P224`, `P256`, `P384`, `P521`. (default: `P224`).

rsaBits.description: When `algorithm` is `RSA`, the size of the generated RSA key, in bits (default: `2048`).

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getCertificate.

content.description: The content of the certificate in [PEM (RFC 1421)](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc1421) format. Cannot be used with `url`.

url.description: The URL of the website to get the certificates from. Cannot be used with `content`.

verifyChain.description: Whether to verify the certificate chain while parsing it or not (default: `true`). Cannot be used with `content`.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getCertificate.

certificates.description: The certificates protecting the site, with the root of the chain first.

content.description: The content of the certificate in [PEM (RFC 1421)](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc1421) format. Cannot be used with `url`.

id.description: Unique identifier of this data source: hashing of the certificates in the chain.

url.description: The URL of the website to get the certificates from. Cannot be used with `content`.

verifyChain.description: Whether to verify the certificate chain while parsing it or not (default: `true`). Cannot be used with `content`.

tls:index/getPublicKey:getPublicKey.description:
Get a public key from a PEM-encoded private key.

Use this data source to get the public key from a [PEM (RFC 1421)](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc1421) or [OpenSSH PEM (RFC 4716)](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc4716) formatted private key, for use in other resources.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getPublicKey.

privateKeyOpenssh.description: The private key (in  [OpenSSH PEM (RFC 4716)](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc4716) format) to extract the public key from. This is *mutually exclusive* with `private_key_pem`. Currently-supported algorithms for keys are: `RSA`, `ECDSA`, `ED25519`.

privateKeyPem.description: The private key (in [PEM (RFC 1421)](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc1421) format) to extract the public key from. This is *mutually exclusive* with `private_key_openssh`. Currently-supported algorithms for keys are: `RSA`, `ECDSA`, `ED25519`.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getPublicKey.

algorithm.description: The name of the algorithm used by the given private key. Possible values are: `RSA`, `ECDSA`, `ED25519`.

id.description: Unique identifier for this data source: hexadecimal representation of the SHA1 checksum of the data source.

privateKeyOpenssh.description: The private key (in  [OpenSSH PEM (RFC 4716)](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc4716) format) to extract the public key from. This is *mutually exclusive* with `private_key_pem`. Currently-supported algorithms for keys are: `RSA`, `ECDSA`, `ED25519`.

privateKeyPem.description: The private key (in [PEM (RFC 1421)](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc1421) format) to extract the public key from. This is *mutually exclusive* with `private_key_openssh`. Currently-supported algorithms for keys are: `RSA`, `ECDSA`, `ED25519`.

publicKeyFingerprintMd5.description: The fingerprint of the public key data in OpenSSH MD5 hash format, e.g. `aa:bb:cc:...`. Only available if the selected private key format is compatible, as per the rules for `public_key_openssh` and ECDSA P224 limitations.

publicKeyFingerprintSha256.description: The fingerprint of the public key data in OpenSSH SHA256 hash format, e.g. `SHA256:...`. Only available if the selected private key format is compatible, as per the rules for `public_key_openssh` and ECDSA P224 limitations.

publicKeyOpenssh.description: The public key, in  OpenSSH PEM (RFC 4716).
